alertitem.alert: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
alertitem.name: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
alertitem.desc: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks. These attacks are used for everything from data theft to site defacement or distribution of malware. CSP provides a set of standard HTTP headers that allow website owners to declare approved sources of content that browsers should be allowed to load on that page — covered types are JavaScript, CSS, HTML frames, fonts, images and embeddable objects such as Java applets, ActiveX, audio and video files.
alertitem.solution: Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to set the Content-Security-Policy header.

alertitem.name: Hidden File Found
alertitem.desc: A sensitive file was identified as accessible or available. This may leak administrative, configuration, or credential information which can be leveraged by a malicious individual to further attack the system or conduct social engineering efforts.
alertitem.solution: Consider whether or not the component is actually required in production, if it isn't then disable it. If it is then ensure access to it requires appropriate authentication and authorization, or limit exposure to internal systems or specific source IPs, etc.

alertitem.name: Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments
alertitem.desc: The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker.

instance.otherinfo: The following pattern was used: \bSELECT\b and was detected in likely comment: "//www.w3.org/2000/svg",l);break;case 2:a=p.createElementNS("http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML",l);break;default:switch(l){case"", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

alertitem.solution: Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
alertitem.otherinfo: The following pattern was used: \bSELECT\b and was detected in likely comment: "//www.w3.org/2000/svg",l);break;case 2:a=p.createElementNS("http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML",l);break;default:switch(l){case"", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

alertitem.name: Modern Web Application
alertitem.desc: The application appears to be a modern web application. If you need to explore it automatically then the Ajax Spider may well be more effective than the standard one.

instance.otherinfo: No links have been found while there are scripts, which is an indication that this is a modern web application.

alertitem.solution: This is an informational alert and so no changes are required.
alertitem.otherinfo: No links have been found while there are scripts, which is an indication that this is a modern web application.
